business.headline: Sensex, Nifty climb as IT stocks shine ahead of US inflation dataThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 224.45 points to close at 76,724.08, while the NSE Nifty50 added 371.5 points to end at 23,213.20.

LTCG tax relief in Budget 2025? What stock market investors are hoping forStock markets are buzzing with anticipation for the upcoming budget, especially after the Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced key changes to capital gains taxation in her seventh Budget.

Budget 2025: 3 key expectations of homebuyersThe housing sector plays an important role in India's GDP and employment generation, raising hopes for reforms to reduce costs and promote homeownership.

Sensex up 500 points, Nifty continues positive run. What investors should doStock market today: The Sensex hit an intraday high of 76,991.05 and was trading 463.37 points higher at 76,963 at 10:55 am. The Nifty50 also rose 110.40 points to 23,286.45.

Adani Green share price surges over 6% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Green share price: At 10:20 am, the stock was trading 3.28% higher at Rs 1,040.60, continuing its positive momentum after jumping as much as 19% in the previous session.
Sensex, Nifty open higher; IT stocks rebound after recent slumpThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 144.53 points to 76,644.16, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.15 points to 23,192.20 as of 9:30 AM.
PepsiCo enters bidding for Haldiram stake against Temasek, Alpha Wave: ReportPepsiCo has initiated discussions with the Aggarwal family, who own Haldiram, for a minority stake.

Meta layoffs: 3,600 to lose jobs as Mark Zuckerberg targets low performersMeta layoffs: The decision, shared in an internal memo by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, focusses on improving overall performance by moving out those not meeting expectations more quickly than before.

Stocks to watch today: HDFC Life, Adani Energy, Vedanta, IRFC, Sula VineyardsShares of companies such as HDFC Life, Adani Energy, Vedanta, IRFC, CESC, Sula Vineyards, and Shoppers Stop are likely to remain in focus today due to news developments and quarterly results announcements.

'We wouldn't do that': ITC chief Sanjiv Puri shares view on 90-hour workweekThe 90-hour workweek debate, triggered by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan's comments, has faced criticism from industry leaders and celebrities.
Mutual fund investors can now nominate up to 10 individuals. Details hereThe new rules enhance investor convenience while ensuring that the nomination process remains secure and transparent.

Are mutual funds risky in a turbulent stock market? Here's all you need to knowIs market turbulence shaking your mutual fund confidence? Find out why experts urge patience and see volatility as a buying opportunity, not a cause for alarm.
ITR filing: Why you should file belated, revised tax returns by January 15Taxpayers missing the original deadline must file a belated ITR to meet obligations.
Credit score check: Why and how often should you review it?A credit score is a numerical measure of your creditworthiness, based on payment history, debt, and credit history length.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi stirs up storm with 'fighting Indian state' remark, faces BJP fireRahul Gandhi stirred a row after asserting that BJP and RSS had captured all institutions of the country and the Congress was now fighting the 'Indian state itself' apart from the two organisations.

Inadvertent error: Meta apologises for Mark Zuckerberg's 2024 poll loss remarkMeta apology: The apology by Meta India comes a day after BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, who heads the parliamentary panel on IT, said it would summon the company's officials over Zuckerberg's remark.

Global bond sell-off: What's going on, and will it have any impact on India?As the global bond sell-off continues to accelerate, here's how rising yields and higher borrowing costs may impact the Indian economy and stock markets.

India smash record 435 vs Ireland, 4th-highest total in women's ODIs: StatsIndia vs Ireland, 3rd ODI: India smashed 435 in 50 overs to become only the third team to post more than 400 in an innings in women's ODIs. Smriti Mandhana and young Pratika Rawal hit a hundred each in Rajkot on Wednesday, January 15.

How BJP and Congress have given Kejriwal a free passDelhi Election: Despite over a decade to regroup, the BJP and Congress have failed to produce a leader who can challenge AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on his turf, Delhi. Now, weeks before the Assembly polls, with no credible leadership in sight, Kejriwal continues to capitalise on a vacuum left by the BJP and Congress, in his bid to retain power in Delhi.

Budget 2025: Is merging old and new income tax regimes a good idea?Budget 2025: Will merging the old and new tax regimes offer the best of both worlds for taxpayers? Experts weigh in on whether a unified system could simplify compliance or introduce new challenges.

Woman opposes marriage, father shoots her with cops present outside homeA woman was shot dead by her father and cousin weeks before her marriage after she voiced opposition to marrying a man of the family's choice. A police team was present outside the woman's home where the crime took place.

The audacity of Mohan Bhagwat: Rahul Gandhi condemns 'true independence' remarkRahul Gandhi, addressing workers after the inauguration of the new Congress headquarters, said Mohan Bhagwat's remarks were an insult to freedom fighters and an attack on the Constitution.

Amul stares at bread daily: Dairy brand shares doodle on L&T Chairman's remarksDuring an interaction with his employees last week, L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan had defended L&T's six-day work week policy.

How RSS has impacted vastu of new Congress headquartersAfter five decades at 24, Akbar Road, the Congress has moved to a new headquarters, Indira Bhawan, a kilometre from the BJP head office at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Wary of having an office on a road named after the long-dead RSS ideologue, the Congress is using its back door as the main entrance. It has preferred Kotla to Upadhyay.

Coldplay in India: Additional tickets for Ahmedabad concert now on saleBookMyShow announced limited tickets to the Coldplay Ahmedabad concert. The sale of the tickets will go live on January 15 at 6 pm.

Ramesh Bidhuri stokes row again with sexist jibe at Atishi: Roaming like a hirniAddressing a meeting in Delhi, BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri said that Delhi Chief Minister Atishi did not meet people in the last four years and is now roaming the city "like a deer" to get votes.

Trump's pic with Coca-Cola CEO creates fizz, Diet Coke 'addict' Elon Musk reactsTrump, known for his love for Diet Coke, was pictured holding a commemorative bottle featuring a custom label reading 'Inauguration of President of the United States Donald J Trump'.

When India's first Army chief KM Cariappa chose duty over familyOn Army Day, we honour Field Marshal KM Cariappa, India's first Army Chief, who refused special treatment for his captured son during the 1965 Indo-Pak war. His unyielding principles and leadership went on to shape the values of the Indian Army.

New antibiotic is 97% effective against infections: All about ZaynichA new experimental antibiotic Zaynich has shown 97% effectiveness in fighting drug-resistant infections, offering hope against the silent pandemic of antibiotic resistance.

Isro's SpaDeX mission has fuel for docking, but not enough sunlightIsro Spadex mission: The operational window for the docking manoeuvres is limited. The opportunity to dock will close on January 20 and will not reopen until March 25, leaving a gap of 65 days.

Raveena Tandon's daughter Rasha's rendition of Amy Winehouse's Valerie goes viralRaveena Tandon's daughter, Rasha Thadani, once impressed as a singer with her rendition of Amy Winehouse's Valerie. Rasha will make her Bollywood debut with Azaad.

India's obesity guidelines updated after 15 years: What's changed?Obesity New Definition: Indian doctors have redefined obesity with new guidelines that consider the unique health challenges faced by the population.

'How is this not God?' California man's home spared as wildfire burns block. VideoCalifornia Wildfire: In the viral video, the man walks through the ruins of his neighbourhood, explaining the destruction surrounding his intact home.

Djokovic breaks Federer's all-time Grand Slam record, storms into 3rd roundAustralian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic won his 430th match at Grand Slams, going past Roger Federer's all-time mark. The Serb overcame a scare from 21-year-old Jaime Faria of Portugal to reach the third round.

Game Changer director Shankar 'not satisfied' with film: Had 5 hours of footageDirector Shankar, in a recent interview, said that he wasn't satisfied with Ram Charan's Game Changer, like any other creation of his. He also spoke about the challenges of editing the film, which was five-hours long.

Indian-origin nurse stabbed in the neck with scissors at UK hospitalAchamma Cherian, a 57-year-old Indian-origin nurse, was stabbed in the neck with a pair of scissors while on duty at Oldham Royal Hospital in the UK. Mohammed Roman Haque has been charged with attempted murder and possession of a bladed article. Cherian remains critically injured in hospital.

Navy gets 'hunter-killer' submarine, warships; PM says emerging as maritime powerIn a ceremony held at Mumbai's Naval Dockyard, PM Modi dedicated the three combatants -- INS Surat, INS Nilgiri and INS Vaghsheer -- to the nation.

Never engaged in non-consensual sex: Author Neil Gaiman on rape claimsThe allegations against the 64-year-old acclaimed author of "The Sandman" comic book series and novel "American Gods" came to light after an article in the New York Magazine detailed the allegations of sexual assault, abuse and coercion.

Urvashi Rautela defends song with Nandamuri Balakrishna, calls it celebration of artUrvashi Rautela called her dance with Nandamuri Balakrishna in Daaku Maharaaj a 'celebration of art'. Despite criticism, she cherishes working with the veteran, calling it a dream come true.

Akshay Kumar welcomes Tabu with a hug as they reunite on Bhooth Bangla setsBollywood icons Akshay Kumar and Tabu are reuniting on screen after a 25-year hiatus in the much-anticipated horror comedy Bhooth Bangla, directed by Priyadarshan.

Chris Martin gives a shout out to his father during Coldplay's Abu Dhabi concertDuring a concert in Abu Dhabi, Coldplay's Chris Martin took a moment to acknowledge his father in the audience. The heartfelt tribute was met with cheers from fans, highlighting the bond between father and son.

KJo recalls hilarious first meeting with Farah Khan. It has a Big B connectionFilmmaker Karan Johar humorously recalled his first meeting with choreographer Farah Khan at a movie preview. Farah hilariously admitted to falling asleep during the film, marking the start of their long friendship.

sports.headline: Pyschology student Pratika Rawal wows fans with unreal consistency: She needs no PRYoung India opener Pratika Rawal left fans stunned with her remarkable consistency in ODIs as she slammed her maiden century in the third ODI vs Ireland.

Naomi Osaka happy to get Karolina Muchova 'revenge' for spoiling 'best outfit' runNaomi Osaka said that she was happy to get a bit of revenge on Karolina Muchova after beating the Czech Republic star in the second round of the Australian Open 2025. Osaka was beaten by Muchova during the US Open last year.
World Rapid champion Koneru Humpy set for Norway Chess women 2025 returnWorld Rapid champion Koneru Humpy is all set for a return to the Norway Chess women 2025 in May.

Watch: Rohit spotted running at Mumbai complex, day after joining Ranji camp India captain Rohit Sharma was seen sweating it out at a private complex in Mumbai, a day after he batted in a training session with the Ranji Trophy team. Rohit will lead India in the upcoming ODI series against England and in the Champions Trophy.

IND-W vs IRE-W: Pratika Rawal hits maiden ODI hundred to continue prolific runPratika Rawal continued her prolific run of form for the Indian women's team as she scored her maiden hundred against Ireland during the 3rd ODI on Wednesday, January 15. Rawal scored her maiden hundred in just 100 balls.

Smriti Mandhana smashes India's fastest hundred in women's ODIsIndia vs Ireland, 3rd ODI: Smriti Mandhana broke Harmanpreet Kaur's record for the fastest hundred by an Indian batter in women's ODI cricket. Smriti also became only the fourth cricketer to score 10 or more hundreds in women's ODis.

Guardiola's animated chat with Ortega: City boss reveals what he told goalkeeperManchester City boss Pep Guardiola revealed what he told his goalkeeper Stefan Ortega after their draw against Brentford on Tuesday, January 14. Ortega was unable to prevent Brentford from scoring the equaliser in stoppage time.

Rishabh Pant leads 3-way battle for wicketkeeper slot in India squadChampions Trophy 2025: KL Rahul became India's preferred wicketkeeper in ODIs during Rishabh Pant's absence, but concerns over his ability to keep wickets for long periods arose after the 2023 World Cup. Pant's left-handed batting adds valuable variety to the middle order, making him a strong contender for India's first-choice keeper for the 50-over tournament.

Alcaraz served up a barrage of aces which stunned Nishioka in Melbourne.

R Ashwin breaks silence on retirement call, not getting farewell TestFormer India off-spinner R Ashwin said believed he was capable of representing India for a longer period than he ultimately did, but maintained his stance against farewell matches.

Hours after shock PSL retirement, Pakistan pacer Ihsanullah makes U-turnJust hours after making his shock retirement from the Pakistan Super League, pacer Ihsanullah has performed a U-turn. The 22-year-old said that he had made the call in the heat of the moment.

Australian Open: Olympic champion Zheng stunned, Mirra Andreeva survives scareThe Olympic champion and last year's runner-up, Zheng Qinwen, suffered a shock exit at the hands of Laura Siegemund on Day 4 of the Australian Open. Mirra Andreeva had to dig deep to overcome a scare by Japan's Moyuka Uchijima to progress to the third round.

Serie A: Lazio fire falconer for posting pictures of penis implant onlineLazio have decided to fire Juan Bernabé, the man who handled the club's official mascot, after the falconer posted pictures of his penis implant online.

Australian Open: Aryna Sabalenka survives 2nd set scare to beat Jessica Bouzas Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka survived an all-mighty scare in the second set to defeat a resolute Jessica Bouzas Maneiro to progress to the third round of the Australian Open 2025 on Wednesday, January 15.

Liverpool held to draw by Nottingham Forest, Manchester City let 2-goal lead slipLiverpool were forced to salvage a 1-1 draw against a resolute Nottingham Forest side, while Manchester City let a 2-0 lead slip to be held 2-2 draw by a determined Brentford on Tuesday, January 14 in the Premier League. Chelsea were able to secure a point against Bournemouth, while Graham Potter secured his first win as West Ham United manager.

Aakash Chopra questions India's T20 World Cup hero's absence in England seriesFormer India cricketer turned commentator, Aakash Chopra, has questioned the absence of India all-rounder Shivam Dube in the team for the upcoming T20I series against England.

Chelsea were able to secure a point against Bournemouth, while Graham Potter secured his first win as West Ham United manager.

Donyell Malen joins Aston Villa on permanent deal from Borussia DortmundAston Villa bolstered their attacking options by signing Dutch forward Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund for 23 million euros, with add-ons. Malen's experience and versatility are expected to strengthen Villa's push for European qualification and domestic success.

Steve Smith on being stuck at 9999 runs: Was thinking about Hazlewood's shirt noStar Australia batter Steve Smith opened up getting stuck at 9999 runs in Test cricket and revealed how he just kept thinking about Josh Hazlewood's jersey number ahead of the game.

Rishabh Pant set to play Ranji Trophy for Delhi, no confirmation over Virat KohliStar India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is all set to play for Delhi in their upcoming Ranji Trophy fixture against Saurashtra. However, there's no confirmation on Virat Kohli yet.

India edge closer to Kho Kho World Cup knockouts after outclassing BrazilTeam India triumphed over Brazil 64-34 at the Kho Kho World Cup 2025, while the Indian women's team secured a historic 175-18 victory over South Korea, setting the stage for a dominant display on Day 2.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
